jobDescription: We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Job Description About the roleMergers and Acquisitions (aka M+A) is a key part of our growth strategy that accelerates our core capabilities. Following the recent creation of a dedicated M+A integration function in our Finance team, we are seeking an "extraordinary" team member to support the execution of finance efforts on future M+A transactions. As our Finance M+A Integration Specialist we will work together as a wider team; where you will be responsible for owning the finance integration tools. You will provide operational support to our integration team and collaborate closely with a global team on integration needs of our business. You will have the opportunity to expand your M+A experience and help develop Arm’s finance integration capability.What will I be accountable for?You will:Provide end-to-end support for all Finance integration processesSupport the development and management of processes, tools and templatesCollate and track integration budgets for each of the workstreams involved in a variety of M+A transactionsDrive continuous improvements by documenting lessons learned and incorporating feedback into updated integration playbooksCommunicate regularly with other functional integration leads to ensure interdependencies are identified and handled Job Requirements What skills, experience, and qualifications do I need?Experience working in a finance function and knowledge of budgeting processesYou possess the ability to manage change and ambiguity, and be able to quickly build a deep understanding of Arm’s current business from a cultural and operational perspectiveYou have mastered an ability to quickly develop credibility and rapport with key partners and work well in a highly collaborative environmentConsistent record of tracking and following up with multiple stakeholders, to ensure timely deliverables and resolve issuesYou have demonstrated attention to detail, are a problem solver, and enthusiastic and willing to be hands on in your workAdvanced skills in Microsoft ExcelWhat are the desired behaviors for this role?At Arm, we are proud to have a set of behaviors that reflect our creative culture and guide our decisions, defining how we work together to "defy ordinary and shape extraordinary". These behaviors are embody our recruitment process:Delivery of results – You demonstrate a can-do attitude and you drive to overcome obstacles, acting with a sense of urgency because you’re passionate about what you do.Partner / customer focus – Your tendency to put your partners and customers first in all that you do by understanding their needs and striving to achieve winning solutions.Creativity / innovation – Possessing curiosity and a passion for continuous improvement through spotting opportunities and seeking the views of others.Collaboration / communication – Your ability to forge lasting relationships which are built upon mutual trust, open communication and sharing of information and success.Personal impact / influence – You listen to all perspectives, evaluate, persuade and carefully shape your work to deliver truly impactful results.Team / personal development – You take time to drive your own development, while encouraging team members and partners to do the same.#LI-KS1 Benefits Your particular benefits package will depend on position and type of employment and may be subject to change. Your package will be confirmed on offer of employment.
